data.title: yield keyword is not highlighted in js file even though target:es6 is enabled in jsconfig.json
Non-git repository causes Code to grab all files on Mac
data.body: When opening a non-git repository in Code, the Git tab seems to pull in every file on my Mac. In Windows, if the folder isn't a git repository, a button to Initialize a git repository is displayed.

data.title: Expand selection and shrink selection in HTML
data.body:
Continuing from here: #495

Expand Select and shrink select work OK in typescript, json and JS. It seems it's not implemented for HTML.

data.title: Could Let's select to update
data.body: Because of some issues happened after updating perhaps, could let's select to update? So we can install the last stable version.

data.title: Expose ILinkSupport in API
data.body:
Hi, I've started to write an extension to provide support for W3C XLink Specification to the xml language the xlink specification provides attributes to document links from an XML fragment o another XML fragment.

At the time I find an xlink:href attribute on an XML node I'm able to create a customized decoration on the attribute value but I'm unable to find the way to properly implement a mechanism to detect when the user has clicked on the decoration. I've actually implemented a DefinitionProvider that is able to open the document but the user must press F12 or right click on the text and select "Go to Definition" but a link is not a Definition but just the link end point.

Cheers,
Ignacio

data.title: Variable value hover tooltips in debugger stop working after first hover
data.body:
Didn't see another issue filed for this already so forgive me if I missed it:

In VS Code December release, we've noticed that when you hover over variable names while the debugger is stopped, it works the first time but then it doesn't work again until you resume debugging and it hits a new breakpoint.  Sometimes I see it stop working entirely even across debugging sessions.  I don't see any requests being made to my debug adapter on hover, so I'm guessing this is happening client-side.

data.title: TypeScript modules fail
data.body:
Whenever I try to export some code in TypeScript I get an error message claiming that VS Code `Cannot compile modules unless the --module flag is provided.`:

![typescript module](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9283914/12129513/6840e888-b404-11e5-9732-f8b231e70aaa.png)

data.title: Auto-close back-tick
data.body:
In VS Code, currently when you type an opening single or double quote, the IDE will auto-close the string.  I.e.

``` javascript
// type single quote, closing quote auto-filled
'<cursor_here>'

// type double quote, closing quote auto-filled
"<cursor_here>"

// type back-tick (es6 template string), no auto-filled closing back-tick
`<cursor_here>
```

As you can see in the above sample (using `<cursor_here>` to indicate where the cursor is located after the char), the back-tick doesn't exhibit the same behavior as the single/double quotes.

This is a nice-to-have, as the template string should follow the same editor behavior as the single/double-quoted strings.

data.title: Proposal: Support colored messages in Output window
Expose 'change language' as command

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I have a [modelines](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items/chrislajoie.vscode-modelines) plugin but it currently lacks the ability to set the language of the file. In order to implement this I would need an API to allow it to be set.

As an example, a Vagrantfile is a ruby script, but Code opens it as plain text. The API should allow plugins to determine the type of file by arbitrary means and set the language appropriately.

data.title: "Undo Last Commit" should be grayed out if there are no commits.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
After initializing git repository, but before committing, I can select "Undo Last Commit" from the "..." menu. That fails, of course. The resulting git reset HEAD~ won't work if there are no commits.

Undo Last Commit should be grayed out if HEAD doesn't have a parent.

Here's the log:

```
git init
git fetch
fatal: No remote repository specified.  Please, specify either a URL or a
remote name from which new revisions should be fetched.
git reset HEAD~
fatal: ambiguous argument 'HEAD~': unknown revision or path not in the working tree.
Use '--' to separate paths from revisions, like this:
'git <command> [<revision>...] -- [<file>...]'
git fetch
fatal: No remote repository specified.  Please, specify either a URL or a
remote name from which new revisions should be fetched.
git fetch
fatal: No remote repository specified.  Please, specify either a URL or a
remote name from which new revisions should be fetched.
git fetch
fatal: No remote repository specified.  Please, specify either a URL or a
remote name from which new revisions should be fetched.
```

data.title: Right-click on branch name
data.body: It would be helpful if I could right click on the branch name in the lower left hand corner to be able to copy the name of the branch (or get other details there, different from what is already provided by left-clicking).

data.title: HTTPS Authentication not working on Linux
data.body:
On VS Code 0.10.6, when trying to sync changes in a HTTPS-backed Git repository, I get an error message which expands to [1] when I click 'show output', if VS Code was run from the desktop environment. If I close VS Code and run it from the terminal instead, I get the username and password prompts _on the terminal_ and typing from there just works (although it's obviously an uncomfortable task-switch).

[1]

```
git fetch
Missing ipc hook
error: unable to read askpass response from '$APPDIR/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/parts/git/electron-main/askpass.sh'
fatal: could not read Username for 'https://bitbucket.org': No such device or address
git pull
Missing ipc hook
error: unable to read askpass response from '$APPDIR/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/parts/git/electron-main/askpass.sh'
fatal: could not read Username for 'https://bitbucket.org': No such device or address
```

(Note: for conciseness I've replaced the directory where the application is installed with $APPDIR)

And here's what I see in the developer tools console:

```
workbench.main.js:63 There was an issue running a git operation.
Please review the output or use a console to check the state of
your repository.: Error: There was an issue running a git operation.
Please review the output or use a console to check the state of
your repository.
    at Object.S [as create] (file:///$APPDIR/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:10:2854)
    at file:///$APPDIR/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:62:16688
    at Object.p [as _notify] (file:///$APPDIR/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:6:181)
    at Object.__dirname.undefined.F.enter (file:///$APPDIR/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:6:3509)
    at __dirname.undefined.t.Class.define._run (file:///$APPDIR/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:6:4830)
    at __dirname.undefined.t.Class.define._chainedError (file:///$APPDIR/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:6:4189)
    at n (file:///$APPDIR/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:6:2017)
    at Object.p [as _notify] (file:///$APPDIR/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:6:181)
    at Object.__dirname.undefined.F.enter (file:///$APPDIR/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:6:3509)
    at __dirname.undefined.t.Class.define._run (file:///$APPDIR/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:6:4830)e.doShow @ workbench.main.js:63
```

And some more version info:

```
Version 0.10.6
Commit a80232bbcfe8a5cdad1ebc98638673d9dcb02458
```

data.title: rich quick pick

There are needs for more complex quick pick and asking for input, like _do something on focus_, _validate user input_ etc. There are:
- [x] user input validation and feedback (#1381)
- [x] handle item focus/blur (#540, #1979)
- [ ] ~~update items based on input~~
- [x] have an option to show label and description in two rows
- [x] have an option to include octicons

data.title: Keybinding widget: "<"-key not working for Swedish keyboard (Windows)
data.body:
When using the Keybinding widget to edit the keybindings.json file, it will just respond with "unknown" when you try to press the key `<`. The `<` key is located between `shift` and `z` (see picture), and I belive that key isn't present on most US-keyboards. 

At first I thought it was a problem with the node-native-keymap but when I try it it gives me the correct binding:

```
...
{ key_code: 'VKEY_OEM_7',
    value: 'ä',
    withShift: 'Ä',
    withAltGr: '',
    withShiftAltGr: '' },
  { key_code: 'VKEY_OEM_102',
    value: '<',
    withShift: '>',
    withAltGr: '|',
    withShiftAltGr: '' } ]

```

Not being able to bind that key makes it more or less impossible to use any vim-extensions since the `<` is used to indent.
I tried searching for a similar issue and all I could find was #1372 which is only somewhat related. I hope this isnt a duplicate.

![keyboard](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2329863/12114699/345297a4-b3ac-11e5-9b4b-c3a662676fae.png)

data.title: loop complete Source objects through debugger UI
data.body:
If a debug adapter wants to support breakpoints in non-standard source like 'inlined source maps', it has to add additional data to the Source object returned to the debug UI and it expects that this data will arrive intact when the UI passes the Source back to the debug adapter. In addition the front-end has to persist this data across sessions.

I've added an optional attribute 'adapterData' to the Source class. VSCode debug UI should leave the data intact and persist it across sessions. VSCode debug UI should not interpret the data.

data.title: Proposal: Add mnemonics to context menu items

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
On Windows systems it looks like context menu items don't have accelleration characters assigned to them. Getting used to accessing context menu items by using the keyboard it would be an improvement to see the acceleration character displayed along with the context menu immediately.

So I suggest to display a context menu item's acceleration character along with the context menu.

data.title: Proposal: Add option to automatically start task runners' tasks

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
In #1789 I suggested to add a `//# task` pragma comment to precede task runner tasks so the IDE will be able to recognize task runner tasks. This proposal here augments the mentioned proposal.
Whenever a project is opened in VS Code, which is indicated by the following preconditions: - a folder gets opened which contains one or more `.js` files - any of those `.js` files contains one or more `//# task` pragma comments - any of those `# task` pragma comments comes with an `autoStart: true` property set ... then the tasks marked with `autoStart: true` should automatically be executed. Here's a screenshot depicting how the `autoStart: true` property is suggested to be applied: ![auto run 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9283914/12098517/2161e340-b323-11e5-854d-c4357cef5c60.png)
Depending on user/workspace settings, a confirmation dialog might be displayed before the tasks are automatically getting started: ![auto run 2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9283914/12098540/3f001566-b323-11e5-8381-5af2a884aacc.png)
Browsing for the `//# task` pragma comment in all `.js` files within the current project root folder might become time consuming, given that there may be many large `.js` files in the project folder. So browsing should be performed asynchronously.
#### The following behaviour is suggested: 1. Browsing `.js` files in the current project root folder for containing `//# task { autoStart: true [, ...]}` should be performed asynchronously after the folder has been opened in Code. 2. A user/workspace setting should be introduced to control whether the confirmation dialog box should be displayed and whether automatic execution of tasks should be performed anyway. The setting should come with the following enumeration: - `always` // always run autostart tasks without showing the confirmation dialog box - `confirm` // as soon as the first `//# task { autoStart: true [, ...] }` pragma comment is parsed by the browser after the folder has been opened in Code, a confirmation dialog is getting displayed to the user. Depending on user selection, any autostart task found in the folder will be getting executed - or none. - `never` // never run autostart tasks 3. Autostart tasks should be run for each file containing one or more `//# task { autoStart: true [, ...] }` pragma comments separately. Tasks defined in different task runners won't depend on each other.
_(The screenshot montage above mentions the text "Do you want to run the autostart tasks stored in gulpfile.js". This text is only a suggested visualization. Mentioning a file name in the text is actually not correct when there is more than one single task runner file about to be scanned and executed, which is the suggested behaviour.)_

data.title: Proposal: Add "Run Task" context menu to any ".js" file containing a "# task" pragma comment

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
In #1789 I suggested to add a `//# task` pragma comment to precede task runner tasks so the IDE will be able to recognize task runner tasks. This proposal here augments the mentioned proposal.
Currently, running a task requires much typing. I suggest to add a context menu to Explorer for any `.js` file containing a `//# task` pragma comment so tasks can easily be browsed for asynchronously by the IDE and a task can simply be started by only two clicks: ![run task](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9283914/12098333/f1cc0666-b321-11e5-8f50-cfc10fae09db.png)
The tasks in the list should be alphabetically sorted and the first task name letter should be used for the mnemonic, so starting a task could be as easy as `CTXT, T, L` for "less" or `CTXT, T, T` for "tsc" in the above screen shot.

data.title: Proposal: Use "pragma comment" for running tasks in VS Code

milestone.title: Backlog
